author: gcolvin
content:
The bot seems to be so picky that it will not let me merge to _my own repo_ without approval!  
https://github.com/gcolvin/EIPs/pull/1
https://github.com/gcolvin/EIPs/runs/4432480701
Not sure if I am doing something wrong, or whether someone needs to fix this.  <@104006934562107392> ?

author: samwilsn
content:
I think that's an artifact of how github actions are configured. You likely need to change your `.github/workflows/...` files.

If this is a problem generally, it might be worthwhile to limit the workflow to only run on the canonical github repository.

author: gcolvin
content:
> change your .github/workflows/... files.
I don't even know what those files are ðŸ˜¦

author: samwilsn
content:
https://github.com/gcolvin/EIPs/tree/master/.github/workflows

They're pretty much only useful if you're building software with github's tooling

author: gcolvin
content: Not building exactly, just editing and EIP.

author: samwilsn
content:
Er, yes.

`s/building software with/executing code inside of`

author: samwilsn
content: That's outside my wheelhouse, but I did raise an issue for the annoying bots: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/4526

author: alita85
content: <@!683653554631868440> you should have admin rights in your repo so you can overwrite the bot, no?

author: gcolvin
content: I told <@!642887713246150666> that I intended to remain an editor.  I've been contributing for 5 or 6 years now.

author: lightclient
content: <@!683653554631868440> when discussed in Oct, you hadn't been actively editing for around a year and so you were removed from the active editor list in the bot

author: lightclient
content:
there was a PR open for about 3 weeks and it was discussed in one of the EIPIP meetings
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/4390

author: gcolvin
content: Well, I missed it, and thought my discussion with Pooja was dispositive.  I don't appreciate being kicked out of an organization I helped to found.

author: poojaranjan
content:
I remember sharing your thoughts of being on the Editors list and continue as an editor in one of the EIPIP meetings and we have you on the EIP-1 as current EIP editors.
Might have I missed on the pings going on to the EIP editors, I suppose that can be updated, clearly you're up for it. With the present numbers of EIP editors, my understanding is we are not in a condition to lose any support we can get on the EIP editing.

author: gcolvin
content: As it stands I cannot merge PRs to the repo and there are not notification that I am available as a reviewer.

author: poojaranjan
content: While discussing the responsibilities of editors, the group seems to have a general agreement that among other editing tasks, it would be nice to have editors showing up in EIPIP meetings even once in a quarter or keep communicating their thoughts via comments on GitHub Issues  & Pull Requests.
